Last year, I led 97 of my colleagues in calling on @EPAAWheeler to abandon plans to dissolve the EPA's Office of the Science Advisor. I'm glad @SenDuckworth brought up the fact that the Office of Children’s Health Protection currently lacks a director. #StopWheeler

The latest @IPCC_CH report confirmed that consequences of inaction on climate change will be serious within our lifetime. @SenBooker is right - the EPA shouldn't be continuing to take regulatory action that "undermines the health and safety of our nation." #StopWheeler

Thank you @SenJeffMerkley for highlighting the devastating effects of climate change in Oregon & emphasizing @EPAAWheeler's denial of climate science. We need an EPA Administrator who will make climate change a priority. The future of our planet depends on it. #StopWheeler

The evidence @SenWhitehouse shared demonstrates the significant conflicts of interest that @EPAAWheeler has as a former fossil fuel lobbyist. This nomination is another example of the Trump Admin doubling down on special interests instead of protecting the public #StopWheeler

@EPAAWheeler claimed that adaptation measures are the best way to respond to rising sea levels and wildfires are mostly caused by poor forest management. This is not consistent with the #NCA4 - which EPA scientists contributed to! #StopWheeler

It is disgraceful that @EPAAWheeler does not agree with the scientific community that climate change is the greatest environmental crisis in the world. Thank you @SenSanders for mentioning that Wheeler didn't even say "climate change" in his opening statement. #StopWheeler
.@SenatorCardin is right - Mercury and Air Toxic Standards have worked in protecting access to clean air & water. @EPAAWheeler couldn't justify why rolling back these safeguards is necessary.

I am glad that @SenatorCarper added the #NCA4 to the record. It is ridiculous that @EPAAWheeler refuses to acknowledge the scientific findings on climate change & continues to propose rules that will increase emissions of dangerous pollutants and harm public health. #StopWheeler

People across the country are being exposed to PFAS-contaminated water and soil. @EPAAWheeler couldn't even commit to having a drinking water standard for PFAS in the next two years. Thank you @SenatorCarper for emphasizing the urgency of this issue. #StopWheeler

.@EPAAWheeler can try to paint efforts to rollback fuel economy standards for light-duty vehicles as a positive step, but transportation is a major source of pollution in the country & hazardous air pollutants disproportionately affect our most vulnerable communities #StopWheeler

.@EPAAWheeler failed to mention that the EPA's own analysis found that the #DirtyPowerScam proposed rule to replace the Clean Power Plan will have negative effects on public health, leading to as many as 1,400 additional premature deaths per year. #StopWheeler

.@EPAAWheeler may say that the EPA has worked to meet the deadlines set by the 2016 Toxic Substances Control Act, but the EPA has failed to protect Americans from asbestos. I'm working with @SenJeffMerkley to ban asbestos. #StopWheeler

.@EPAAWheeler said that the "U.S. is the gold standard for environmental progress" but, because of actions by the Trump Administration, our country has fallen far behind the pledges made in the Paris Agreement and is unlikely to meet the targets set by 2025. #StopWheeler

.@EPAAWheeler can claim he will protect public health & the environment, but his actions as Acting Administrator prove otherwise. He has dismissed scientists, defended polluters, and ignored scientific evidence on climate change. #StopWheeler

The Trump Admin putting forward Wheeler to run like the EPA is like giving the fox the keys to the henhouse— except our kids and grandkids are the hens. As Andrew Wheeler testifies at @EPWDems today, RT to #StopWheeler and show you won’t let the EPA be gutted without a fight.

During a government shutdown, when federal employees at the @EPA are not getting a paycheck, Andrew Wheeler should not be considered for a promotion. At minimum, this hearing should be delayed until the government reopens. #StopWheeler

Wheeler’s efforts to rollback and repeal protections will cause irreparable damage to our planet. He has attacked fuel economy standards, methane leak monitoring and repair requirements, landmark mercury and air toxic standards for power plants, clean water, & more. #StopWheeler
A former coal lobbyist who ignores science should not be leading the @EPA. I'm calling on my colleagues in the Senate to reject Andrew Wheeler's nomination. #StopWheeler

He says “while I am sure you are voting to reopen the government I am asking you to please do everything you can to make it happen. There are people in a worse position than my family.”

He and his wife sat down this week to look at their bank accounts and make a back-up plan if this shutdown continues. If that happens he will have to get a second job, sell his truck, or take out a loan.

Another #CoastGuard member from Astoria contacted me to share his family’s story. He has a one-year-old and a new baby who will be six weeks old this week. The government has been shut down for more than half her life.
He asked me to please remind my colleagues that “the brave service members of the #CoastGuard do not deserve to be used as a political chess piece.”

He is part of the search & rescue teams, which have been very active this winter saving lives in tough conditions on the Oregon and Washington coast. His job also requires a security clearance, and if he or his colleagues were to default on a loan that clearance could be revoked.

I heard from a constituent who is proud to be from a Coast Guard family- he and his two brothers are all Coasties. He and his wife have some savings but they won’t last long, and he is worried about his older brother, who is a single dad with two daughters.

It is absolutely unacceptable that members of the Coast Guard have to worry about their family finances while working to keep our country safe.

Our oceans cannot keep taking the brunt of our inaction on climate change. As Co-Chair of the House Oceans Caucus and a leader on @HouseScience, I am ready to work with my colleagues to protect, conserve, maintain, and rebuild our ocean resources. https://www.nytimes.com/2019/01/10/climate/ocean-warming-climate-change.html …

The oceans reflect the health of our planet and a new report found they are absorbing 93% of the heat trapped by human greenhouse gas emissions. Warming oceans result in sea levels rising, coral bleaching, changes to fish migration patterns, & more extreme weather events.
The American people have been held hostage long enough. It is past time for the President to abandon his ill-conceived border wall, and reopen the federal government before more people are hurt.
With Democrats in the majority, the House has taken swift action to reopen the government. We have passed bipartisan bills to fund government operations and pay workers who have been furloughed.
Members of the Coast Guard, air traffic controllers, and so many others have shared how they are suffering as a direct result of President Trump’s unnecessary government shutdown. This must stop.

A federal law enforcement employee  just received an eviction notice after trying to explain the shutdown to his apartment manager.  In a few days, he and his family will be kicked out of their apartment if they do not receive a paycheck in time to pay their rent. #ShutdownStory

I shared some of their stories on the House floor today: A TSA agent who, along with his wife, had to sell plasma to make ends meet. A counselor at the fed prison who wonders how she can make federal student loan payments without a paycheck. #ShutdownStory https://youtu.be/ug_DSikAJts

I’ve spoken with individuals from Astoria, Sheridan, Hillsboro, Portland, and beyond who are worried how they are going to pay for rent, how are they going to afford childcare, or continue to pay their student loans if their paycheck does not come through on Friday.

Missing even one paycheck can have catastrophic consequences. It is far too high a cost for dedicated federal employees to pay for a policy fight they did not start and have no power to end. #TrumpShutdown

I will do everything I can to reject the continued attacks on science and stand up for the EPA’s critical work to address climate change and protect the health of our families.

This morning I met with federal employees who are worried about making ends meet while working without pay. It is completely irresponsible for President Trump and GOP Congressional leaders to hold these employees and the American people hostage for a campaign promise.

I had the pleasure of sitting down with @PDXBIZJournal to talk about my priorities for this year. https://www.bizjournals.com/portland/news/2018/12/20/pbj-interview-rep-suzanne-bonamici-lives-in-oregon.html …
Day 2 of the new Congress: feeling the strength of the women in our caucus! pic.twitter.com/hhJNeZHI9U

We have the opportunity & the imperative to protect our planet by reducing greenhouse gas emissions, investing in renewable energy, & defending science. One of my top priorities this Congress is taking bold action to combat climate change. I'm proud to join @SEEC to #ActOnClimate

A top legislative priority of the new Democratic Majority is returning power to the people by reforming government. Today we introduced #HR1 the #ForThePeople Act, to restore the Voting Rights Act, fight corruption, & more. pic.twitter.com/BnTZg78BMy

At the start of the 116th Congress, I’m proud to join my colleagues in passing a new rules package that reflects our values as a Democratic caucus. It increases transparency, creates a Select Committee on the Climate Crisis, bans LGBTQ discrimination, & much more. pic.twitter.com/WKMw7wS24e

My priorities for this session mirror the concerns I have heard from NW Oregonians during town hall meetings and conversations. I’ll strive to increase access to affordable health care for all, make higher education more accessible, act on climate, & more. https://bonamici.house.gov/media/press-releases/bonamici-sworn-4th-full-term-congress-will-vote-reopen-government …

Representing Northwest Oregon is a great honor and I’m humbled to have the trust of Oregonians for another term. I am excited and energized to serve as part of the Majority for the first time since I came to Congress. pic.twitter.com/e5ODDgGLOg

As a leader on the @SciCmteDems, I will keep fighting to reduce carbon emissions, accelerate our transition to 100% clean energy, rebuild our nation’s infrastructure in sustainable and resilient manner, & create new good-paying jobs. #ActOnClimate #ClimateCrisisCountdown

We will strengthen our oversight over the Trump Administration's efforts to withdraw from the #ParisAgreement, suppress science, roll back the Clean Power Plan, fuel economy standards, methane emission controls, and safeguards for clean air & clean water. #ClimateCrisisCountdown

Today, @HouseDemocrats are in the Majority in the House and we are ready to use this information to #ActOnClimate. We have the ability and the obligation to lead the world’s efforts to curb greenhouse gas emissions. #ClimateCrisisCountdown

The #NCA4 findings demonstrate that w/out substantial efforts to reduce greenhouse gas emissions & adapt to the changing climate, there will be significant consequences for our environment & communities.
Thank you to everyone who helped me amplify the significance of #ClimateChange by joining the #ClimateCrisisCountdown.

The #NCA4 is the most comprehensive science-based evaluation of the consequences of climate change, the risks of inaction, & potential adaptation strategies for the U.S. to date. Since the Trump Admin tried to suppress the findings, I shared them daily #ClimateCrisisCountdown

Approximately 85% of total U.S. greenhouse gas emissions are a result of fossil fuel combustion. Methane from fossil fuel extraction, industrial processes, agricultural land-cover change, and waste processing account for the remaining emissions. #NCA4 #ClimateCrisisCountdown

As we reflect on 2018 and look ahead to the start of a new Congress in 2019, I’m grateful to everyone across NW Oregon for the honor of representing them. Check out my Instagram story @RepBonamici to see some of my favorite photos from each month. pic.twitter.com/DFSDFRWwtP

Projected increases in inland flooding over the coming century threaten approximately 2,500 to 4,600 bridges across the U.S. and are estimated to result in average annual damages of $1.2 to $1.4 billion each year by 2050. #NCA4 #ClimateCrisisCountdown

Happy New Year! In 2018, it felt like a week’s worth of news happened daily. Here’s hoping that 2019 is just as noteworthy, but with a lot more #GoodNews for our climate, our children, our seniors, and everyone in our communities and around the world. pic.twitter.com/flyYCwtOco
